contentrichtext.text: [[Image:York St School.JPG|right|thumb|250px|York Street Public School]] '''York Street Public School''' is an elementary school in the [[Lower Town]] neighbourhood of [[Ottawa]], [[Canada]]. The school was built in 1922<ref>Cummings, H.R. and W.T. MacSkimming. ''The City of Ottawa Public Schools: A Brief History.'' Ottawa: Ottawa Board of Education, 1971.</ref> replacing four smaller schools in the area: Robinson Primary, George Street, Rideau Street, and Bolton. The school plays a prominent role<ref>Doyle, Brian. ''Angel Square,'' 1984.</ref> in the books of children's author [[Brian Doyle (writer)|Brian Doyle]], who is a graduate. York Street Public School places an emphasis on community involvement. During the school year, York Street P.S gets involved in many initiatives including the [[Bell Canada]] Raise-A-Reader Program, the Heart of the City Music Program and also Child and Youth Friendly Ottawa's SOAR Leadership Program. They have been champions at the OCDSB's annual Math & Tech Competition in 2005. The school runs daily from 8am - 2:30pm. <!-- Unsourced image removed: [[Image:y100_edited1.jpg]] -->==References== <references /> ==External links== [http://esip.edu.gov.on.ca/english/profiles/school_info.asp?ID=B66184&schoolid= Ottawa-Carleton District School Board] {{OCDSB}} {{coord|45.432063|N|75.682905|W|region:CA-ON_type:landmark|display=title}} [[Category:Elementary schools in Ottawa]] [http://ocdsb.ca/yorkweb]
